posts.author: TheSquid

This is a DEX-based battle cleric with high damage output. I played it 1 - 40 solo on WoG and it performed very solidly.
Features (with a Haste potion, capped stats, and +5 items):
  • 10 attacks per round starting at 63 AB
  • 52 average damage per hit (slashing/fire/divine/magical)
  • 79 AC
  • Buffs are immune to Greater Dispelling
  • Level 8 Cleric spells
Cons:
  • Actually M.A.D. (multiple attribute dependent), i.e. you ideally want to cap at least DEX, WIS and CHA. And you want +8 STR from items. And of course some CON, you are a 300 HP melee warrior after all
  • Low HP
  • Needs Knockdown immunity from items
  • 90 skillpoints total, and cannot speak properly either
  • 20% XP penalty from level 19
I consider this a power build, if not a very versatile one. You can only do one thing, but you do it extremely well. With proper preparation and gear, I think you can beat any reasonable encounter.

Commentary:
The idea of this build is very simple: combine EWS, Cleric buffs and divine feats to obtain high AB, high AC, and high damage on a melee fighter. The result performed very well, and I was able to play it solo through the World of Greyhawk PW with no major hindrances. 
You have very high damage output basically all your melee life (say from level 9 on), and your AB is consistently high as well. AC lags a bit behind but should be alright in epics, and it is high in the endgame levels.
Dispels are annoying as with any self-buffer, but Craft Wand is your friend! You can easily rebuff if you get dispelled/breached as long as you plan ahead in wand and spell preparation.
Damage shields and casters in general are an issue, but you have several weapons against them: 1. Self-silence before they buff and kill them, 2. Wait out the shields, and 3. A bow. Number 1. In particular works well against bosses and is very satisfying. Number 3. works as long as you can keep Spell Resistance up.
The best part of playing this build was fighting certain kinds of bosses, e.g. dragons, who will cast some buffs and use some abilities before they start hitting you. Like cast Haste - cast Spell Mantle - use breath weapon a couple times. You deal so much damage that by then they are down to using their heals and the fight is over before it even starts :)

Choice discussion and variations:
An obvious variation one can make is to end on 20 WIS and 28 DEX for more spells, see the balanced version below.
Apart from that, one can play around with starting stats a bit (lowering CHA to raise INT or CON, for instance), change domains, change levelling order, and change feats.
Craft Wand is amazing in this build if you have access to unlimited XP and gold, and Trickery is chosen in part because invisibility spells can be put on wands. Magic is chosen because it’s the best you can do on WoG as a Lawful Human with Trickery, and it turns out that it too provides nice spells (MA, Ice Storm, Stoneskin make good wands!). If I had a free domain choice, or if I wanted to drop Craft Wand, I would go Plant, War, Travel, or Animal instead of Magic. Trickery is too good on a melee build with low HP, and as a plus it allows you to turn into a Rogue once a day; so that I would keep in any case.
Apart from Craft Wand, the only other feat I would consider changing is Epic Prowess for Improved Crit. I think as long as you have keen kamas EP represents more damage in reasonable situations, but I’m not sure. And it depends a lot on enemy DR/DI.
The levelling order I propose gets EWS at 24 and undispellability at 34. You could argue that an earlier undispellability is more important, this was a tough choice.

Balanced version:
Following feedback by Maximillian Kane, here is a more balanced version of the build which has access to level 9 spells and a couple more spellslots at lower levels. The price to pay is -1 AB (and slightly different saves, one can argue whether better or worse). 
I believe this version is slightly worse at level 40: you have an extra 6 level 9, 1 level 7, 1 level 3 slots, which is not bad, but no great spells to fill them with. Realistically your Summon VIII become Summon IX and you gain some extra Extended Regenerate/Mass Heal. 
On the other hand, the extra 1 AB means 20+ damage/round vs 70ish armor, which is 10% of your damage output. That is quite a lot, so I prefer the “greedy” version as a level 40 build.
A major difference is while levelling though: the greedy version has only level 7 spells until level 32, while the balanced version gets level 8 spells at 15 and level 9 spells at 21. That should make the high teens-low epic levels a lot easier. Not that they are hard anyway.

Similar builds:
The class combination has been used a lot, but I think not with Weapon Finesse, Divine Might and Epic Weapon Specialisation. Melee builds that utilise these classes include:
Limburger Cleric (Cleric 30/ Fighter 4/ Monk 6) by Mithdradates: good build, similar to this one but trashing CHA in exchange for better everything else.
Warrior Priest of Dexterity (Cleric 24/ Fighter 6/ Monk 10) by Pan Draconis: also similar to this one but with no divine feats.
The Cuisinart (Cleric 15/ Fighter 24/ Monk 1) by Mithdradates: STR-based, and 8 CHA.
Battle priestess (Fighter 6/ cleric 28/ monk 6) by Ajatar: This one has EWS and Divine Might, but opts to pump WIS. I don’t understand the idea well, I think, but my build is a lot better as a fighter.

Here you have it in all its MADness, comments and suggestions are appreciated.
Cheers!

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
I like this build. Love the originality, and I suppose it's a very creative way of making a "me fight good" character. That 8 INT is killing me, as I like to access all the content on WoG, and with pretty much no skill points, makes me wonder how much you missed out on during your levelling. But the idea is great.

You forgot to mention that you lose 1 AB on the balanced version, but gain 1 AC that isn't subject to flat-footed loss, as you're swapping a DEX AC point for a WIS AC point. The only problem is that because you need Power Attack, you can't really relinquish any STR points, even though DP will set it to 18 regardless of what the original score is.

Kudos for the creativity! Cheers!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
How did you survive Greater Ruin?

Really curious about this because on WoG it has been strengthened and all the bosses have it at insane power - with 300 hps, it's a 1 shot (can do over 400+ damage).

It was the only thing I really worried about. Getting hit with like 7 was total death (which can happen at a certain Drow place).

Other than that, not bad.

Sent from my SM-G955F using Tapatalk

posts.author: TheSquid
posts.content:
@Maximillian_Kane 
indeed, "me fight good" is exactly how this guy would phrase it! You are right that 8 INT is a bummer, but I don't think there is any way around it without sacrificing AB and AC. 
And I will concede that the balanced version has a whooping 38 AC when flat-footed, which still means you should just avoid being flat-footed :)

@webshaman1 
According to my death log, I never died to Greater Ruin. I think I was not ever hit by it, in fact, managing to tank it with Summon 8 or my trusty Wand of Endless Skeletons. In at least one case, a mage boss was not able to even cast GR due to silence.
But yes, this is a build where the moment you see that the incoming IGMS is not going to be blocked by SR you say "blimey" and immediately drink/cast Heal. Just in case.
